home.title:
Inhabit the Earth differently,
together.
home.subtitle: EGOEJO brings together guardians of the living. We network resources, knowledge and committed people to care for the world. Workshops, living places, action-research: each project is an experience to share.
home.relier_desc: Weave alliances between inhabitants, organizations and territories to restore the commons of the living.
home.apprendre_desc: Experiment in the field, document and share regenerative practices at the local level.
home.transmettre_desc: Accompany change actors with immersive, sensitive and grounded formats in reality.
home.soutenir_title: Become an ally of the living
home.soutenir_desc: Each contribution fuels concrete actions: refuges, food gardens, transmission workshops, research residencies, support for local communities. 100% of donations are used to fund these projects.
home.membership_desc: Join the association and contribute in France
home.international_support_desc: Make a one-time or recurring donation via Stripe

univers.title: Universe
univers.subtitle: The EGOEJO universe is a weaving of places, stories and practices that reinvent our way of being in the world. Here, the living is not a backdrop, but a partner.
univers.theme_vivant_desc: Discover our approach to the living and biodiversity: an invitation to listen to the rhythms of the earth, to learn from ecosystems, to observe the invisible relationships that connect humans, animals, plants and elements.
univers.theme_histoire_desc: Explore our roots: stories of lands, migrations, resistances and transmissions. Understanding where we come from to better choose where we are going, together.
univers.theme_reliance_desc: Reliance is the art of weaving connections between people, places and stories. It is the ability to feel part of something larger than oneself, to make every encounter an opportunity for cooperation.
univers.cta_subtitle: The EGOEJO universe is traversed by the great questions of our time: ecological crisis, social injustices, cultural uprooting. We approach them with sensitivity, lucidity and creativity.
univers.references_item1: Stories of places and engaged communities
univers.references_item3: Paths of concrete action to experiment
univers.references_item4: Inspirations to nourish your own projects

vision.title: Vision
vision.subtitle: Our vision is to create a sustainable and inclusive ecosystem where technology and nature coexist harmoniously. We believe in a future where every action counts to care for the world.
vision.highlight_text: Inhabit the Earth differently, together. This is our vision: a world where the living is at the heart of our decisions, where every action counts.
vision.pillar_relier_desc: Weave alliances between inhabitants, organizations and territories to restore the commons of the living. Create bridges between ancestral knowledge and contemporary practices.
vision.pillar_apprendre_desc: Experiment in the field, document and share regenerative practices at the local level. Each project is an experience to share, each mistake a lesson.
vision.pillar_transmettre_desc: Accompany change actors with immersive, sensitive and grounded formats in reality. Share knowledge so it can be reappropriated and adapted.
vision.cta_subtitle: Do you share this vision? Do you want to contribute to building a more just and regenerative world? Join us and participate in this collective adventure.
vision.values_desc: Our vision is based on strong values: respect for the living, cooperation, transmission, experimentation, and territorial anchoring. These values guide each of our actions and decisions.

alliances.title: Alliances
alliances.subtitle: EGOEJO is built through alliances: with territories, communities, organizations, people. These alliances are the living fabric of our collective action.
alliances.highlight_text: Alone we go faster, together we go further. Alliances are at the heart of our action: they allow us to create synergies, share resources and amplify our impact.
alliances.type_territoriales_desc: We weave links with engaged local actors: communities, associations, citizen collectives. Together, we create projects anchored in territories, respectful of ecosystems and communities.
alliances.type_savoirs_desc: We connect researchers, practitioners, guardians of ancestral knowledge and innovators. These alliances allow us to cross perspectives, enrich our practices and create new hybrid knowledge.
alliances.type_internationales_desc: We develop partnerships with organizations around the world that share our values. These alliances allow us to exchange experiences, pool resources and amplify our impact.
alliances.cta_subtitle: Do you represent an organization, a collective, a community? Do you want to create an alliance with EGOEJO? Contact us and let's explore together the possibilities of collaboration.
alliances.partners_desc: EGOEJO works with a diverse network of partners: associations, communities, social enterprises, research centers, local communities. This diversity is our strength and our wealth.

projets.title: Projects
projets.subtitle: Discover the projects carried by EGOEJO and its partners: refuges, food gardens, transmission workshops, research residencies, support for local communities.
projets.highlight_text: Each project is an experience to share, an invitation to experiment, learn and contribute to the regeneration of the living.
projets.no_projets_desc: Projects will be available soon. Come back later or contact us to learn more.
projets.cta_subtitle: Each contribution, small or large, makes it possible to realize these initiatives. Discover how to support a project or propose your own.
projets.cta_proposer_desc: Share your idea and find allies.

communaute.title: Community
communaute.subtitle: EGOEJO is above all a community of people engaged for the living. We gather around common values: respect for the living, cooperation, transmission, experimentation and territorial anchoring.
communaute.highlight_text: The community is the beating heart of EGOEJO. Together we create, experiment and transmit. Every voice counts, every contribution enriches our collective action.
communaute.engagement_rejoindre_desc: The EGOEJO community brings together people engaged for the living: researchers, practitioners, artists, activists, citizens. Together, we share knowledge, experiment with practices and build alliances.
communaute.engagement_evenements_desc: We regularly organize events: workshops, conferences, residencies, meetings. These moments allow us to meet, exchange, learn and create lasting bonds.
communaute.engagement_contribuer_desc: Each member of the community can contribute to projects according to their skills, availability and desires. Whether you are an expert or a beginner, your contribution is precious.
communaute.cta_subtitle: Do you share our values? Do you want to contribute to our collective action? Join the EGOEJO community and participate in this human and ecological adventure.
communaute.values_desc: The EGOEJO community is built around strong values: benevolence, cooperation, diversity, inclusion, respect for the living, experimentation, transmission. These values guide our interactions and actions.

votes.title: Votes
votes.subtitle: EGOEJO operates according to principles of participatory democracy. Community members can propose projects, vote on strategic orientations and participate in collective decisions.
votes.highlight_text: Participatory democracy is at the heart of our functioning. Every voice counts, every decision is collective, every project is co-constructed.
votes.governance_democratie_desc: EGOEJO operates according to principles of participatory democracy. Community members can propose projects, vote on strategic orientations and participate in collective decisions.
votes.governance_processus_desc: Votes are organized in a transparent and inclusive manner. Each member can express their opinion, propose alternatives and participate in debates that precede decisions.
votes.governance_transparence_desc: All votes and decisions are documented and accessible to the community. This transparency allows us to understand collective choices and build shared governance.
votes.cta_subtitle: Do you want to participate in votes and collective decisions? Join the EGOEJO community and become an actor in our shared governance.
votes.how_desc: Votes are organized regularly on different topics: projects to finance, strategic orientations, collective choices. Each member can propose voting topics, participate in debates and express their opinion. Results are public and documented.

rejoindre.title: Join EGOEJO
rejoindre.success_message: Your request has been sent successfully.

contenus.title: Contents
contenus.subtitle: Discover our educational content: podcasts, videos, articles, poems and other resources that nourish our understanding of the living and our relationship to the world.
contenus.highlight_text: Each content is an invitation to discover, learn and share knowledge that nourishes our understanding of the living.
contenus.no_content_desc: Content will be available soon. Come back later or contact us to learn more.
contenus.share_subtitle: Do you want to share educational content that nourishes the EGOEJO vision? Send us your suggestion and we will document it carefully.
contenus.types_desc: We accept different types of content: podcasts, videos, articles, poems, songs and other educational resources that enrich our understanding of the living.

citations.title: Voices that accompany us
citations.subtitle: These words are sensitive landmarks to guide our decisions, nourish our projects and remind us of the place of the living at the heart of our alliances.
citations.highlight_text: Connecting the voices of the world is illuminating the paths that remain to be invented.
citations.cta_subtitle: Do you want to share a quote or reference that nourishes the EGOEJO vision? Send us your suggestion and we will document it carefully.
citations.references_desc: A detailed bibliography is being updated. In the meantime, contact us to get references related to each quote or to share your own sources.

voix_autochtones.title: Indigenous Voices
voix_autochtones.description: Speeches that reanchor our imaginations in the dignity of First Peoples, in the memory of their cosmologies and their resistances.

quotes.text: "I am a damned Savage. I am very proud when, today, I hear myself called Savage. When I hear the White man pronounce this word, I understand that he is constantly telling me that I am a true Indian and that I am the first to have lived in the forest. Now, everything that lives in the forest corresponds to the best life. May the White man always call me Savage."
quotes.author: Antane Kapesh, An.

quotes.text: "They say that a certain woman named Eataentsic is the one who made the earth and men. They give her as an assistant a certain one called Iouskeha, whom they say is her grandson, with whom she governs the world; it is Iouskeha who takes care of the living and things concerning life, and therefore they say he is good: Eataentsic takes care of souls, and because they believe she makes men die, they say she is evil. And these are among them mysteries so hidden that only the elders can speak of them with credit and authority, to be believed. Whence it comes that a certain young man having discoursed to me about it, said to me boasting, Am I not very learned? Some tell me that the house of these two Deities is at the end of the world towards the East. Now among them the world does not extend beyond their Country, that is to say America, others lodge them in the middle. This God and this Goddess live like them, but without want; make feasts like them, are lascivious as well as they: in short they figure them all such as they themselves are. And although they make them men and corporeal, they nevertheless seem to attribute to them a certain immensity in all places. They say that this Eataentsic fell from Heaven, where there are inhabitants as here, and that when she fell, she was pregnant. But if you ask them who made Heaven and the inhabitants, they have no other answer, except that they know nothing about it. And when we preach to them a God, Creator of Heaven and earth and all things: likewise when we speak to them of a Hell and a Paradise, and the rest of our mysteries; the obstinate respond, that this is good for our Country, not for theirs; that each Country has its ways of doing."
quotes.author: Jean de Brébeuf, Relations of what happened in the Country of the Hurons (1635-1648)

quotes.text: "The White man probably never knew that the Indian possesses a degree: when he went to find him in his territory, the Indian hid it from him. But today he is not ashamed to show the White man that he too, as an Indian, possesses a degree and he is not ashamed to make it known. The Indian, he has no certificate to hang on the wall attesting that he is a graduate: it is in his head that his degree is found."
quotes.author: Antane Kapesh, An.

metamorphoses.title: Metamorphoses and Becoming
metamorphoses.description: These texts invite us to look at ongoing ruptures as so many passages towards other ways of inhabiting the world, assuming the discomfort of transitions.

quotes.text: "What the caterpillar calls death, the butterfly calls rebirth."
quotes.author: Violette Lebon

quotes.text: "We are living through one of the most fundamental changes in history: the transformation of the belief system of Western society. No political, economic or military power can compare to the power of a change at the level of our mind. By deliberately changing their image of reality, men are changing the world."
quotes.author: Willis Harman

quotes.text:
"The civilization born in the West,

by casting off its moorings with the past,

believed it was heading towards a future of infinite progress,

thanks to the joint progress of science, reason,

history, economics, democracy.

But we learned, with Hiroshima,
that science was ambivalent;
we saw reason regress and Stalinist delirium
take the mask of historical reason;
we saw that there were no laws of History
guiding irresistibly towards a radiant future;
we saw that the triumph of democracy was
nowhere definitively assured;
we saw that industrial development could lead
to cultural devastation and deadly pollution;
we saw that the civilization of well-being
could produce at the same time ill-being.

If modernity is defined as unconditional faith
in progress, in economic development,
then this modernity is dead."
quotes.author: Edgar Morin

quotes.text:
"This new transmodern and post-capitalist knowledge society has already been born, it is there before our eyes. But we do not see it, because no one talks to us about it but also and especially because our glasses are still too often modern, industrial, capitalist and patriarchal.

To put it figuratively, we continue to look with industrial glasses, so much so that we do not even see the new society that is before us and in which we bathe. Sometimes we meet companies or groups in civil society that are already in this new movement, but we do not see them because we do not have the right glasses."
quotes.author: Marc Luyckx Ghisi

feminin_sacre.title: Sacred Feminine and Cycles of the Living
feminin_sacre.description: A set of words that rehabilitate the body, cycles, sensuality and the creative force of the feminine in human societies.

quotes.text: "One of the most powerful means of understanding what mobilizes a society is to observe its representation of the divine. A vision of this divine, which denies any significant role to the feminine, leaves little room for women to honor themselves or to honor their bodies."
quotes.author: Bernard Lietaer

quotes.text: "In the beginning was the breast. For almost all of human history, there was no substitute for breast milk. Indeed, until the end of the 19th century, when pasteurization made animal milk safe. A mother's breast meant life or death for every newborn. It is hardly surprising that our prehistoric ancestors endowed their female idols with impressive breasts."
quotes.author: Marylin Yalom

quotes.text: "The mystery is always the body, the mystery is always the body of a woman."
quotes.author: Hélène Cixous

quotes.text: "While men ventured beyond their lands to hunt game, women protected the cows, supplying them with food and drink. Both, women and cows, gave milk. Both were sources of regeneration and life. Water, livestock, milk and women were the source of regeneration and nourishment. These mental associations had a profound psychological significance. Together, they provided the fundamental notions of Egyptian religion: birth, death and resurrection. The image of a cow goddess is omnipresent in Egypt from the first dynasty as shown by the famous Narmer palette."
quotes.author: Fekri A.

quotes.text: "The shell called cowrie has been, of all forms of money, a currency much more widespread and for a much longer duration than other forms, including even precious metals. The cowrie, with its vulva-like shape, is associated with the water in which it forms and with the fertility specific to this element. It is traditionally linked to sexual pleasure, prosperity, luck and fecundity. For the Aztecs, the moon god Tecaciztecatl, literally meaning 'the one of the shell', possesses many attributes: the process of birth and generation."
quotes.author: Jean Chevalier & Alain Gheerbrant

quotes.text: "The cowrie connects death with the cosmological principles of water, the moon, the feminine and rebirth in a new world."
quotes.author: Abbé Breuil

quotes.text: "It is generally believed that Chinese culture has always been a solid patriarchal system. This is not the case, for China also had, in Nu Kua, the archetype of an all-powerful mother goddess. According to texts from the Zhou period, Nu Kua was a goddess in the form of a serpent who had created all people with clay. She had also established the order of the universe by making the four directions of the compass, creating the order of the seasons and placing the stars and planets on their respective trajectories."
quotes.author: Merlin Stone

regards_critiques.title: Critical Views on Modernity
regards_critiques.description: Thinkers who question modern Western society and propose to rehabilitate our sensitive, intuitive and collective part.

quotes.text: "What we do not raise to the level of our conscious reappears in our lives as destiny."
quotes.author: Carl Gustav Jung (attributed)

quotes.text:
"The evolution of Western mentality has been driven by a heroic effort to forge an autonomous and rational human being by separating it from the primordial unity with nature.

The religious, scientific and philosophical perspectives of Western culture have been affected by this decisive masculinity, beginning four millennia ago with the great patriarchal conquest of the nomads, in Greece and the Levant, of the ancient matrifocal cultures, conquests manifest in the patriarchal religion of the West, of Judaism, in the rationalist philosophy of Greece and in the objectivist science of modern Europe.

All have served the cause of the development of human autonomous will and intellect: the transcendent self, the independent individual ego, and the self-determined human being in his uniqueness, his difference and his freedom. But to do this, the masculine spirit has repressed the feminine. Whether we see it in the subjugation of pre-Hellenic matrifocal mythologies of ancient Greece, in the Judeo-Christian denial of the Mother Goddess, or in the exaltation of the detached and self-conscious rational ego of the Enlightenment, an ego that is radically separated from a disenchanted external nature, the evolution of Western thought has been based on the repression of the feminine, on the repression of undifferentiated unitary consciousness, of mystical participation with nature: a progressive denial of the anima mundi, of the community of being, of the all-pervading, of mystery and ambiguity, of imagination, emotion, instinct, body, nature, woman, of everything in which the masculine has projected itself by identifying it as 'other'."
quotes.author: Richard Tarnas

footer.description: EGOEJO is a weaver of links, a counter of stories and a forger of practices that reinvent our way of being in the world.

seo.default_description: EGOEJO — connecting citizens to high-impact social projects. Investing in the future with meaning — donations that circulate, connect and fertilize.
seo.home_description: EGOEJO brings together guardians of the living. We network resources, knowledge and committed people to care for the world.
seo.home_keywords: EGOEJO, collective, living, social projects, impact, donations, community, environment
seo.univers_description: The EGOEJO universe is a weaving of places, stories and practices that reinvent our way of being in the world. Explore the living, history and reliance.
seo.univers_keywords: universe, living, history, reliance, ecosystems, biodiversity, stories
seo.vision_description: Our vision is to create a sustainable and inclusive ecosystem where technology and nature coexist harmoniously. Inhabit the Earth differently, together.
seo.vision_keywords: vision, future, ecosystem, sustainability, ecological transition
seo.projets_description: Discover our concrete and grounded projects: refuges, food gardens, transmission workshops, research residencies.
seo.projets_keywords: projects, actions, impact, refuges, gardens, workshops, research
seo.rejoindre_description: Join the EGOEJO Alliance and participate in high-impact social projects. Become an ally of the living.
seo.alliances_description: Discover our alliances and partnerships to create a supportive and committed network for the living.
seo.communaute_description: Join an engaged and supportive community that cares for the world. Participate in exchanges and projects.
seo.votes_description: Participate in votes and collective decisions of the EGOEJO community. Your voice matters.
seo.citations_description: Discover the quotes and reflections that inspire our action and our vision of the world.
seo.contenus_description: Access our educational resources and content to deepen your knowledge of the living and transition.
